div.p: In some cases, the same code or identifier system might accidentally be created more than once in a registry, for example because someone failed to check for an existing entry before adding a new one or knows the same concept with a different name. If this occurs, one of the system entries should be deleted and the remaining entry should have its uniqueId updated to include any identifiers present on the original entry (and possibly have its descriptive information modified to include additional information from the duplicate entry).

The NamingSystem resource has a url property. The NamingSystem resource also specifies preferred identifiers for the Identifier or Code system that is being described. These are not the same thing; the url property of the NamingSystem itself identifies the registration of the system - the description itself, where as the preferred identifiers identify the system being described.
The NamingSystem.url SHOULD not be the same as a URL in the preferred identifiers list, and it would not therefore appear in a Coding.system or an Identifier.system.
